title: Pluton is a Person, Not a Weapon (Like Poseidon)
author: u/IzzaPizza22
theoryText: Pluton is not actually the Warship laced with weapons, but it is actually a person who possesses the voice of all things, just like Poseidon. The revelation in Episode 569 that Poseidon is a person rather than an object suggests that all three ancient weapons might follow the same pattern, with Pluton potentially being a person with a special ability rather than the warship described in the blueprints.

title: Poseidon's Connection to Conqueror's Haki
author: Game Rant
theoryText: Poseidon's ability to exert control over Sea Kings appears similar to Conqueror's Haki, where the user exerts their will externally onto others. This theory suggests there may be a connection between the ancient weapons and advanced forms of Haki, with Poseidon representing an ultimate form of will projection that specifically affects Sea Kings rather than general creatures.

title: Poseidon's Protective Purpose Against the Great Flood
author: Various Fans
theoryText: Considering that the enemy which these weapons are meant to be used against is both capable of and interested in drowning the entire world, Poseidon may be meant primarily as a last-ditch weapon of protection rather than destruction. With her ability to command Sea Kings, Shirahoshi could save drowning humans during a worldwide flood, suggesting the ancient weapons were created to protect against catastrophic events rather than cause them.

title: Joy Boy's Apology Hints at Fish-Men Slavery Connection
author: Fandom Wire
theoryText: Joy Boy's apology to the Fish-Men in the poneglyph might hint that he was somehow responsible for or unable to prevent the brutal slavery that Fish-Men and Merfolk have endured. The promise involved using Noah and Poseidon's power, possibly to relocate the Fish-Men to the surface, but Joy Boy's failure meant they remained vulnerable to human prejudice and slavery for 800 years.

title: Luffy Will Fulfill Joy Boy's Promise
author: This Write Guy
theoryText: Neptune's statement that 'someday someone will come to fulfill Joy Boy's promise' is directly foreshadowing Luffy's role as the successor to Joy Boy. The promise involving Noah and Poseidon will eventually be fulfilled by Luffy, likely involving using Shirahoshi's power to command Sea Kings and Noah to relocate the Fish-Men and Merfolk to the surface world, ending their isolation and persecution.

title: Noah's Purpose: Mass Migration to the Surface
author: One Piece Community
theoryText: The massive ship Noah was built during the Void Century for a mass migration of Fish-Men and Merfolk from Fish-Man Island to the surface world. Queen Otohime's dream of surface migration and the royal family's duty to protect Noah until 'the appointed time' suggests that Joy Boy's original promise was to use Poseidon's power to have Sea Kings pull Noah to the surface, allowing the entire population to relocate and live peacefully with humans.
